Ratings.comment: Great Prof.
The class was super straight forward and Casey always puts students mental health and time first. She's a great professor.
Casey is an angel. Choose her, you will never regret and have a good time in the GE natural science course!
Professor Angel, it's great to see brainless choices!
angel!
Angel professor. The course is self-paced, not any specific due date. A very recommended natural science GE or elective!

Very well laid out course. Very caring professor, who will put your mental health first. Same assignments due each week. Multiple chances on weekly quiz. No test, and a final project with a clear grade outline. Very accessible, responding within 48 hours. Grades Timely. Truly enjoys teaching. You will learn more than you expect. Easy GE Science 3.0

Not a super hard professor but she's really nice and willing to help you understand anything you don't get. She was super helpful if you reached out but you can also just coast on your own and never show up to class and still get an A. Really fun class and great prof!
She's so fun and nice! Sometimes she uploads assignments later in the week, but they're quite easy.
Great class and great professor. She makes the class very accessible and the Carmen page is set up incredibly well.

This class was a super easy GE course. Casey is very knowledgeable about current events and does a great job incorporating DEIJ into her lessons. She is super lenient with deadlines. My only issue was that I emailed multiple times with questions and got no response.
Casey is an absolute QUEEN! Amazing class to take for a GE - great balance of actually learning, but no stress.

Casey is a great prof all-around. No true deadlines meaning you can learn the material at your own pace. The material was interesting and she lets you get creative with the final project. She is also very kind and understanding of personal issues.

Cares about you and accepts late work no matter how late, weekly quiz with 2 attempts based off of the lecture videos and a final project that you have complete control and choice over. So easy, takes a max of 2 hours a week, and is so fun! Casey also really cares about her students' wellbeing
Easy A

Casey was very straightforward with the material for this class and the other classes she teaches. If you are able to keep up with the homework that is due every Sunday and complete a few projects, then you will be just fine taking a class like this and any of the other classes she teaches.
SO GOOD!! She was so nice and understanding with no "true" deadlines for any assignments. The best and easiest GE I have taken at OSU with minimal work, an easy A!

Great Professor! VERY easy GE. All late work accepted. Can move at own pace. There is a project for the final. 
Amazing class!

I took the class asynchronously. Prof was very organized when it came to class material. Lectures were interesting and had humor. Very reasonable grader, and prof offers plenty of opportunities to make sure students can succeed. 10/10 would recommend taking her classes, especially if you're looking for a gen ed.

Incredibly friendly & understanding. Easiest professor at OSU. Take her for this class if you're looking for effortless gen ed. Flexible with due dates with no questions asked. It's almost impossible not to get an A. My only complaints are 1) minimal feedback on the project, but the lowest grade on each step was 100%. 2) Takes a while to grade.

Great professor. The lecture is power point heavy, but she makes it not so dry. Attendance is taken every day and counts toward your grade. Plenty of extra credit opportunities. The research poster project can feel like a lot, but the structure of the course forces you to not wait until the last minute to do it. DO NOT procrastinate the poster.

Super chill teacher and super funny. She knows how to keep the class engaged and even lets class out 20 minutes early and does a mid class stretch. All quizzes and exams are open resources. The poster work can be annoying and somewhat difficult, but you really can't complain because the rest of the class is so easy.

Nadia was so funny and witty, she was great at engaging students and having an open class. Her teaching method was great and I really understood what she was talking about. Tests are straightforward. Attendance is mandatory. One of my favorite professors at OSU

I took this class for ENR 2100 and I loved this professor! Quizzes and tests were fairly easy and the lecture slides provided to you are very helpful. The only thing I struggled with for this class was the research poster assignment, but just go to your TA office hours if you need help and give yourself plenty of time to complete it.

The class was overall super easy and informative. The quizzes and exams are online and you can complete them on your own time. You also are allowed to use notes/resources during the quizzes/exams. She was really chill and I would recommend taking this course with her!

Overall an easy A if you do the work, but I learned a lot. Class got out 20 minutes early, played music often, and there was always a mid-class stretch which created a very chill environment. She does like class participation but it isn't mandatory. Attendance is only worth 4% and everything you need to know for assignments is in carmen.

I really liked Dr. Casillas-Ituarte. She does like to have the class participate so if you're not paying attention she might call you out. Other than that she was an amazing lecturer and very reasonable when it came to grading. Everything she included was very informative and I overall really enjoyed that class for a GE.

This class was very informative, and the professor was understanding about early morning lectures, with non mandatory attendance, posting slides on carmen, allowing coffee in class, and a mid-lecture stretch.
Great Prof.
The class was super straight forward and Casey always puts students mental health and time first. She's a great professor.
Casey is an angel. Choose her, you will never regret and have a good time in the GE natural science course!
Professor Angel, it's great to see brainless choices!
angel!
Angel professor. The course is self-paced, not any specific due date. A very recommended natural science GE or elective!

Very well laid out course. Very caring professor, who will put your mental health first. Same assignments due each week. Multiple chances on weekly quiz. No test, and a final project with a clear grade outline. Very accessible, responding within 48 hours. Grades Timely. Truly enjoys teaching. You will learn more than you expect. Easy GE Science 3.0

Not a super hard professor but she's really nice and willing to help you understand anything you don't get. She was super helpful if you reached out but you can also just coast on your own and never show up to class and still get an A. Really fun class and great prof!
She's so fun and nice! Sometimes she uploads assignments later in the week, but they're quite easy.
Great class and great professor. She makes the class very accessible and the Carmen page is set up incredibly well.

This class was a super easy GE course. Casey is very knowledgeable about current events and does a great job incorporating DEIJ into her lessons. She is super lenient with deadlines. My only issue was that I emailed multiple times with questions and got no response.
Casey is an absolute QUEEN! Amazing class to take for a GE - great balance of actually learning, but no stress.

Casey is a great prof all-around. No true deadlines meaning you can learn the material at your own pace. The material was interesting and she lets you get creative with the final project. She is also very kind and understanding of personal issues.

Cares about you and accepts late work no matter how late, weekly quiz with 2 attempts based off of the lecture videos and a final project that you have complete control and choice over. So easy, takes a max of 2 hours a week, and is so fun! Casey also really cares about her students' wellbeing
Easy A

Casey was very straightforward with the material for this class and the other classes she teaches. If you are able to keep up with the homework that is due every Sunday and complete a few projects, then you will be just fine taking a class like this and any of the other classes she teaches.
SO GOOD!! She was so nice and understanding with no "true" deadlines for any assignments. The best and easiest GE I have taken at OSU with minimal work, an easy A!

Great Professor! VERY easy GE. All late work accepted. Can move at own pace. There is a project for the final. 
Amazing class!

I took the class asynchronously. Prof was very organized when it came to class material. Lectures were interesting and had humor. Very reasonable grader, and prof offers plenty of opportunities to make sure students can succeed. 10/10 would recommend taking her classes, especially if you're looking for a gen ed.

Incredibly friendly & understanding. Easiest professor at OSU. Take her for this class if you're looking for effortless gen ed. Flexible with due dates with no questions asked. It's almost impossible not to get an A. My only complaints are 1) minimal feedback on the project, but the lowest grade on each step was 100%. 2) Takes a while to grade.

Great professor! Casey is very understand and truly does her best to make sure her students succeed. Minimal coursework-- easy A. This class was fully online but I didn't spend more than an hour a week on work.

I really enjoyed her as a professor. Weekly lecture notes and quizzes were very easy. She let you turn in anything late with no questions asked, including the final project. For the project, you were allowed to choose your own topic and it was very easily graded as long as you follow the steps. Offered extra credit as well. TAKE HER YOU WONT REGRET

I wish there was a "0" option for difficulty, I'm so glad I took this class for my physical science GE, great professor, great lectures, and extremely easy work, spend 10 minutes per week outside of the class and you're guaranteed a 100%

Hands down easiest class at Ohio State. Asynchronous, only assignments are weekly are fill in powerpoint slides and easy quiz, and late work is always accepted, no questions asked. Very good addition to my schedule to balance other harder classes and a great GPA booster!

Best and easiest GE ever. Not once stressful. Took in person but didn't show up to class after a month because I could do it all online in less time. She's a super lenient and understanding teacher. no exams or essays! if you need to fill an elective credit, I highly recommend any class with Casey.
Shes just awesome. 1105 is the easiest class ive ever taken. no exams
Very caring professor, very laid back, loved having her
She was very informative and an extremely kind teacher. I would recommend everyone take her classes or else.
Wow, best professor ever! Casey truly cares about her students and absolutely wants them to succeed. Genuinely no way that you do not ace this class, she makes learning very enjoyable.

THE BEST WOMAN AND PROFESSOR EVER!! She is so mindful of everything that she says and does. I truly wish her the best, she cares so much about her students and I wish I could've had her in person. BTW easiest class ever, no way you can't get an A

TAKE THIS CLASS shes so nice and is lenient with deadlines and her assignments are easy. Im not a science person but I loved this class. you have 1 final project but you can have fun with it and its not stressful. one of the best OSU classes

She was an amazing professor. She told us to focus on classes for our major first and never to be stressed out over class. She allowed us to have flexible due dates and was easy going, as long as you get the assignments turned in. Be honest with her, she's human too. She cares about the well being of her students. Amazing professor.

Casey is really helpful with work both in and out of the classroom. If you want help with anything, she cares so much. No tests, no exams, open-book quizzes, guided notes, conversational lectures, no due dates. Everything is easy and you can learn as much or as little as you want. Sorta guaranteed an A.

TAKE GEOLOGY OF NATIONAL PARKS WITH HER. Amazing teacher. Very knowledgeable and the material is interesting. Doesn't believe in due dates, just has to be turned in by end of the year. Puts mental health first. Easy notes, quizzes, surveys, and a project. Extremely caring and wants you to succeed. Relaxing class.

She is literally the best professor I've ever had. I switched my major based on this class. She is so understanding and aware of what it's like to be a student. Her lectures are fun and easy to follow and the class is structured very nicely. She always accepts late work for full credit. Literally, the best 1000% take her if possible.

I took Earthsc 1105 online asynchronous for a GE and She is amaaazing and very understanding. She's very compassionate with grading and due dates but also has an amazing set up for course structure and her lectures are very informative, I've found myself retaining most information. This has been the best experience I've had with a professor.

Casey is the only professor that I have actually felt cared by. She cares about your mental health and truly seems like a down-to-earth person. If you do the work you will easily pass this class. I can go on and on about how great she is but I promise she won't disappoint.

Casey is awesome and has a great sense of humor. Easily my favorite professor at OSU. Super caring and always available to help her students. I actually learned a ton of interesting stuff in her class but it didn't feel like work because she made it fun and got us to want to learn things for ourselves.
Such an easy class, takes me 20 minutes to complete the assignments for the week. No textbook, no exams, and just overall very easy and fun. Take it for an easy A and a really nice professor!

Casey is the nicest teacher I have ever had. She made the class very easy while also teaching us a lot. She cared about how we are doing and wanted us to get an A in the class. Only had guided notes for participation and quizzes that had unlimited attempts and were not timed. She asked us how she was doing this week and how we are doing. Very nice.

The kindest professor I've ever had. The course was only graded on guided notes for the lectures and weekly quizzes (unlimited attempts and time). She was so understanding and aware of student's feelings toward her class and if work load or life just became too much, and would accommodate work/deadlines if needed. Can't recommend her enough.

Oceanography was a very easy lived environments gen ed class. If you read the textbook with attending the lectures the tests will be easy.  There are four tests, but the lowest of them is dropped and there are some extra credit questions at the end. She's always willing to give extra assistance if you need it.

Prof Diaz cares a lot about her work and is very knowledgeable about the subject she teaches. It's a lecture heavy class and although she assigns readings, I never did them and did fine on the exams. The homework assignments are also simple and there are only a few of them. It's a great course to take if you love the ocean and need a theme course.

Diaz is obviously passionate about her field and puts that into her class. Attendance is checked on Acadly for credit. Homework assignments are simple, but be prepared to have them assigned over breaks/holidays. Pay attention to the personal info she shares as this is used as extra credit on exams. Read the textbook and you'll do fine on the exam.

You can tell that Dr. Welch cares about what she's teaching, however she's very quiet and a little boring. Her TA was what made this class awful. She graded things as if this wasn't a GE class, made the tests impossible and was on a complete power trip even though she's the same age as most of her students. Every test average was a C.

Look at the good comments, in the same time...while in that time, Spring and summer semesters end for a long time. The good comments from Douglas himself I think. He rates himself, what a mean, and bad professor.
The quiz from the professor of this class makes it difficult for you to cope.
This teacher's quiz waits until the class can't be changed. This leads to students having no idea how difficult the class is.
If you just want the credits for GE physical, plz go to earthscience 1105, Dr. Casey. She is a good professor, with good quiz. If you choosed this class, you will cryyyyyyyyyyyyy
Bad class, bad quiz, even you can use your book, it cannot help you.
Don't believe the good coments... they just want you to choose this terrible class
Don't believe that 2 guy who gave the high score. It is diffiuclt!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The e-book for you it is too diffiuclt to fine the answer.

ES1121 was a hybrid course that allowed for lecture attendance, or purely remote access. Professor Alsdorf is very comfortable in how he teaches the class, and was not afraid to have fun with his lectures and it made them much better. For remote study I highly recommend using the recorded lectures over the presentations.

Professor Alsdorf had great lectures that were engaging and full of helpful information. He made the class intriguing and mostly easy to follow, despite the material being a bit dry. I Definitely recommend taking this class if you need earth science credit.

This was my second semester of having Ben and he is an amazing professor. He is very understanding and encouraging and he is very approachable. Genuinely great guy and I'm sad I won't be able to take any more classes with him.

A very good teacher. Clear lectures, great at answering questions, very accessible outside of class. Was good at focusing on the important content and skimming through the irrelevant stuff. My only complaint is that the lab reports for the class are a pain, but if you don't do them all the day before like I did they shouldn't be too bad.
Ben was a great teacher, one of the best I've ever had. He genuinely cares about and respects students and tries to create a fun and inclusive class environment.

Ben is amazing, he keeps his lectures pretty short and gives us a ton of time to work on our assignments in class. This class does have a decent amount of work, but his teaching helps to make it easier! He genuinely cares about his students and goes out of his way to get to know us

Absolutely amazing professor for a very difficult class. The workload would not be doable if not for him being knowledgeable and approachable. 3 credit hours is extremely misleading, the class requires much more time in and out of class than is stated

Dr. Grier was great. Really appreciated how responsive he was to students throughout the length of the course, and he was incredibly caring for all his students. ENGR 1282.01H is a difficult class in the sense that it is incredibly time consuming (more similar to a 5 CH class), but Ben made it substantially easier. Take him, he's great!

Ben was fantastic as an instructor. However this class has the workload of a 10 credit hour class despite only being 3 hours. Take this class with caution, since you will be dedicating a lot of time outside of class on the robot. Ben is the best instructor to choose from though, so if you want to take this class, he is your guy

Ben is one of my favorite professors so far at school. He is a real personable guy that takes the time to get to know you and earn your respect. Reading isn't required and if you have previous coding knowledge, not really necessary. His class is engaging and the structure allows for most work to be done in class.

Ben is a great lecturer and is always happy to help you learn the material. It's pretty obvious he wants you to love the content of FEH as much as he does, and this strategy oftentimes works. The class itself isn't terrible (other than labs), and you will do well on the tests with a little studying (or none if you already know how to code).

I loved Dr. Grier. Loved him so much, I took him next semester for 1182. This was a fun class but get ready to work. I thought I finished with an A but the final exam killed me. This course material sucked because 95% of it was programming on MATLAB so if you arnt CSE, good luck trying to get an A.

He made 1181 a pleasure to go to, although the class does require more than two credit hours of work. He's very peppy, and very open to help students. The TA grading was fair, not harsh, and I'm saying that as someone who did not do half the application assignments (don't be afraid to ask questions, I was in the beginning bc of ass groupmates).
Best professor I had for the semester. Grading is tough but it is pretty much going to be the same with any other professor for the course.

Dr. Grier is a fantastic professor, he's super involved and fun in class, but is also really invested in his students learning the material. The TAs are brutal graders but this is by design as it's a "weed-out" course for engineers. Material is very easy but but you'll have to put in way more than 2 credit hours of work for an A in this class.
Was very chill and respectable, the TAs were tough graders but the class wasn't too terribly difficult.
Love the way he does his tests, makes everything less stressful.

I just finished up taking Earth Sci 2203 with Professor Cole and he was amazing! This was one of my first in person experiences since the start of covid and I absolutely loved him. He was friendly, funny and lenient in terms of grading. I highly recommend taking him for this course.
Attendance isn't mandatory but there are a few random pop quizzes that usually aren't announced, but are sometimes hinted at. Isn't a difficult class to pass, just don't miss those pop quizzes.

Professor Lenz is an absolute gem. Never met a Prof who was more helpful, more kind, so passionate in lectures! I was in her first class she ever lectured and workload is completely fair, she prepares students well for exams, and she is always MORE than willing to help. <3 her.

She is very kind and genuinely wants her students to succeed. Lectures are somewhat hard to follow because she gives you lots of extra info, so I often was left confused sifting through the info I needed to actually know. Go to office hours, where she explains everything more clearly. Go to class because of pop quizzes and explaining the homework
